questions.question: He made the sandwich by ________.
questions.explanation: "Himself" is used because "he" does something to him.

questions.question: They cleaned the room all by ________.
questions.explanation: "Themselves" is used when "they" do something to them.

questions.question: "Themselves" is used when talking about one person.
questions.explanation: "Themselves" is used when talking about more than one person.

questions.question: She wrote a story about ________.
questions.explanation: "Herself" is used because "she" does something to her.

questions.question: "Myself" is used when you do something to yourself.
questions.explanation: "Myself" is a reflexive pronoun used when "I" do something to me.

questions.question: The dog played with ________ in the yard.
questions.explanation: "Itself" is used because "the dog" does something to it.

questions.question: "Herself" is used for a boy.
questions.explanation: "Herself" is used for a girl, while "himself" is used for a boy.

questions.question: I taught ________ to ride a bike.
questions.explanation: "Myself" is used because "I" do something to me.

questions.question: He can tie his shoes by ________.
questions.explanation: "Himself" is used because "he" does something to him.

questions.question: You should take care of ________.
questions.explanation: "Yourself" is used because "you" do something to you.

questions.question: We had a great time by ________.
questions.explanation: "Ourselves" is used because "we" do something to us.

questions.question: The cat licked ________ clean.
questions.explanation: "Itself" is used because "the cat" does something to it.

questions.question: We enjoyed ________ at the park.
questions.explanation: "Ourselves" is used because "we" do something to us.

questions.question: The bird hurt ________ when it flew into the window.
questions.explanation: "Itself" is used because "the bird" does something to it.

questions.question: She likes to read books by ________.
questions.explanation: "Herself" is used because "she" does something to her.

questions.question: The boy can dress ________.
questions.explanation: "Himself" is used because "the boy" does something to him.

questions.question: You should be careful by ________.
questions.explanation: "Yourself" is used because "you" do something to you.

questions.question: The kids made lunch for ________.
questions.explanation: "Themselves" is used because "the kids" do something to them.

questions.question: He read the book all by ________.
questions.explanation: "Himself" is used because "he" does something to him.

questions.question: I can do it by ________.
questions.explanation: "Myself" is used because "I" do something to me.
